instruction: Describe the film industry in the 1920s.
output: The film industry in the 1920s was extremely active and popular. With the introduction of sound films, the industry saw an even larger surge in popularity. Hollywood became the epicenter of movie production, and some of the most iconic films of the era such as The Jazz Singer, The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari, and Nosferatu were released. Studios were independent at this time and usually operated with a tight budget. Technological advancements were also made, such as more advanced editing techniques and improved sound recording devices.
